boat.name: Provident

owners.note: Bought in 1951 John Bayley who founded the Island Cruising Club she continued under Club ownership until 1971 when she was bought by the Maritime Trust and subsequently the Island Trust. She was bought by the Trinity Sailing Foundation in 2002.

boat.full_description:
Built by Saunders & Co. on the River Dart in 1924, for skipper William Pillar, 'Provident' is a medium sized Mule class gaff ketch and fished 'with three men and a boy'. After only six years fishing, an American, Captain RH Lagarde, purchased her for conversion to a yacht using Morgan Giles design.

Remaining in the West Country up to and during the Second World War, she continued cruising, including the Baltic ports and had an engine fitted. Since 1951 her sailing career continued as a charter vessel with restoration and refit programmes undertaken in 1986 - 1991 and 2013 - 2014. A new engine was installed in 2016.

Owned by the Trinity Sailing Foundation since 2002, 'Provident' provides adventure and sail training to the public, including youth and disadvantaged groups. She has taken part in OGA events in the South West and Solent as well as several of the major French festivals.

Read about her return to the water in Classic Boat, March 2016.

Watch the video showing 'Provident' at sea and undergoing significant restoration in 2013.
boat.short_description: One of the last trawlers built to work under sail, 'Provident' fished for six years before being converted to a yacht. She has cruised extensively around the West Country and Baltic ports. After being out of service for more than a year, she takes part in the Brixham Heritage Sailing Regatta, May 2016.
